intro: Cryptantha dichotoma, commonly known as the two-branched cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant produces clusters of pale blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate and pinnately compound, with small, oval-shaped leaflets. Cryptantha dichotoma is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
